questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Italy was destroyed by a volcanic eruption in 79 AD?
questions.context: This ancient city provides a glimpse into Roman life, frozen in time by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius.

questions.question: Identify the UNESCO site known for its temple complex dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu, located in Cambodia.
questions.context: Built in the early 12th century, this is the largest religious monument in the world and a symbol of Cambodia.

questions.question: Which UNESCO site in India is famous for its rock-cut architecture dating back to the 2nd century BCE?
questions.context: These caves are renowned for their stunning frescoes and sculptures depicting Buddhist traditions and teachings.

questions.question: What UNESCO World Heritage Site in Jordan features rock-cut architecture, including the famous Al-Khazneh?
questions.context: This archaeological city, once the capital of the Nabataean kingdom, is known as the 'Rose City' for its color.

questions.question: Where is the UNESCO site located that contains the Great Wall built during the Ming Dynasty, stretching over 13,000 miles?
questions.context: This section of the Great Wall is near Beijing and one of the best-preserved, allowing insights into China's historic defenses.
